Container.Name: openldap
Container.Overview: A docker image to run OpenLDAP, The container default log level is info. Available levels are: none, error, warning, info, debug and trace. To use this container with phpldapadmin, create a custom network that both containers are on and then link them using --link openldap:PHPLDAPADMIN_LDAP_HOSTS in the extra parameters of the phpldapadmin docker container (which should be equal to HOSTNAME in this container). Any other docker that wants to use LDAP credentials will need the same extra parameter including Let's Encrypt if you are using linuxserver.io's ldap-auth container.

Config.Description: LDAP database files

Config.Name: LDAP config files
Config.Description: LDAP config files

Config.Name: LDAP port
Config.Description: Container Port: 389

Config.Name: LDAPS port
Config.Description: Container Port: 636

Config.Name: LDAP_ORGANISATION
Config.Description: Organisation name e.g. Example Inc.

Config.Name: LDAP_DOMAIN
Config.Description: Ldap domain e.g. example.org

Config.Name: HOSTNAME
Config.Description: Set the hostname of the running openldap server. This is the value linked to other containers so they can connect with ldaps://example.org:636. In that example, example.org is the hostname.

Config.Name: LDAP_ADMIN_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Ldap Admin password. Defaults to admin

Config.Name: LDAP_CONFIG_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Ldap Config password. Defaults to config

Config.Name: LDAP_TLS
Config.Description: Add openldap TLS capabilities. Can't be removed once set to true. Defaults to true.

Config.Name: LDAP_TLS_CRT_FILENAME
Config.Description: Ldap ssl certificate filename. If getting certs from Let's Encrypt, this should be of the form: live/example.org/cert.pem

Config.Name: LDAP_TLS_KEY_FILENAME
Config.Description: Ldap ssl certificate private key filename. If getting certs from Let's Encrypt, this should be of the form: live/example.org/privkey.pem

Config.Name: LDAP_TLS_CA_CRT_FILENAME
Config.Description: Ldap ssl CA certificate filename. If getting certs from Let's Encrypt, this should be of the form: live/example.org/fullchain.pem

Config.Name: LDAP SSL Certificate Path
Config.Description: Shared volume with Let's Encrypt certs. Create a docker volume -> docker create volume letsencrypt-keys, then link it in your linuxserver.io/letsencrypt docker container with container path: /config/etc/letsencrypt and host path: letsencrypt-keys

Config.Name: LDIF Custom Configs Path
Config.Description: Place custom LDIF configs here for apps that require them (such as apache-guacamole).

Config.Name: LDAP_READONLY_USER
Config.Description: Add a read only user. Defaults to false

Config.Name: LDAP_READONLY_USER_USERNAME
Config.Description: Read only user username. Defaults to readonly

Config.Name: LDAP_READONLY_USER_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Read only user password. Defaults to readonly

Config.Name: LDAP_RFC2307BIS_SCHEMA
Config.Description: Use rfc2307bis schema instead of nis schema. Defaults to false

Config.Name: LDAP_BACKEND
Config.Description: Ldap backend. Defaults to mdb (previously hdb in image versions up to v1.1.10)

Config.Name: LDAP_TLS_ENFORCE
Config.Description: Enforce TLS but except ldapi connections. Can't be disabled once set to true. Defaults to false.

Config.Name: LDAP_TLS_VERIFY_CLIENT
Config.Description: TLS verify client. Defaults to demand

Config.Name: LDAP_TLS_CIPHER_SUITE
Config.Description: TLS cipher suite. Defaults to SECURE256:+SECURE128:-VERS-TLS-ALL:+VERS-TLS1.2:-RSA:-DHE-DSS:-CAMELLIA-128-CBC:-CAMELLIA-256-CBC

Config.Name: KEEP_EXISTING_CONFIG
Config.Description:
Do not change the ldap config. Defaults to false
if set to true with an existing database, config will remain unchanged. Image tls and replication config will not be run. The container can be started with LDAP_ADMIN_PASSWORD and LDAP_CONFIG_PASSWORD empty or filled with fake data. if set to true when bootstrapping a new database, bootstap ldif and schema will not be added and tls and replication config will not be run.

Config.Name: LDAP_REMOVE_CONFIG_AFTER_SETUP
Config.Description: Container Variable: LDAP_REMOVE_CONFIG_AFTER_SETUP

Config.Name: LDAP_SSL_HELPER_PREFIX
Config.Description: ssl-helper environment variables prefix. Defaults to ldap, ssl-helper first search config from LDAP_SSL_HELPER_* variables, before SSL_HELPER_* variables.

Config.Name: LDAP_BASE_DN
Config.Description: LDAP_BASE_DN: Ldap base DN. If empty automatically set from LDAP_DOMAIN value. Defaults to (empty)
